page.title: 17Starkey Castle Farm
page.content: {Starkey Castle}is a fourteenth century{manor house.}It is in very bad condition inside and is in the process of being restored by a retired barrister,{Mr Gerald Davies.} At the moment there is still scaffolding in the Great Hall because the roof is being repaired. There is a chapel on the first floor which has a modernised stained glass window in it. On the ground floor the rooms have been plastered by a machine which sprays plaster. The outside is in quite good condition. The building itself is made out of{Kentish ragstone and flint.} Mr Davies is interested in old buildings and once it is restored completely he is going to live in it. He hopes to use the Great Hall for concerts and exhibitions in order to pay for the restoration.
